    Examples for ddst package

    Przemyslaw Biecek

    July 26, 2019

    examples_all.Rmd

    Data Driven Smooth Tests with ddst package

    This document presents tests avaliable in the ddst package.

    library("ddst")
library("polynom")

    II. Data driven smooth tests for selected goodness-of-fit problems

    1. Data Driven Smooth Test for Uniformity

    z <- c(13.41, 6.04, 1.26, 3.67, -4.54, 2.92, 0.44, 12.93, 6.77, 10.09,
       4.10, 4.04, -1.97, 2.17, -5.38, -7.30, 4.75, 5.63, 8.84)
ddst.uniform.test(z, compute.p = TRUE)
    ## 
##  Data Driven Smooth Test for Uniformity
## 
## data:  z, base: ddst.base.legendre  c: 2.4  Dmax: 10
## WT = 1.9112e+33, T = 10, p-value < 2.2e-16
    # when H0 is true
z <- runif(80)
ddst.uniform.test(z, compute.p = TRUE)
    ## 
##  Data Driven Smooth Test for Uniformity
## 
## data:  z, base: ddst.base.legendre  c: 2.4  Dmax: 10
## WT = 1.3408, T = 1, p-value = 0.273
    # for known fixed alternative, here N(10,16)
z <- pnorm(z, 10, 16)
ddst.uniform.test(z, compute.p = TRUE)
    ## 
##  Data Driven Smooth Test for Uniformity
## 
## data:  z, base: ddst.base.legendre  c: 2.4  Dmax: 10
## WT = 518.85, T = 10, p-value < 2.2e-16
    # when H0 is false
z <- rbeta(80,4,2)
ddst.uniform.test(z, compute.p = TRUE)
    ## 
##  Data Driven Smooth Test for Uniformity
## 
## data:  z, base: ddst.base.legendre  c: 2.4  Dmax: 10
## WT = 49.944, T = 4, p-value < 2.2e-16
    # just p-value
ddst.uniform.test(z, compute.p = TRUE)$p.value
    ## [1] 0

    2. Data Driven Smooth Test for Exponentiality

    # for given vector of 19 numbers
z <- c(13.41, 6.04, 1.26, 3.67, -4.54, 2.92, 0.44, 12.93, 6.77, 10.09,
       4.10, 4.04, -1.97, 2.17, -5.38, -7.30, 4.75, 5.63, 8.84)
ddst.exp.test(z, compute.p = TRUE)
    ## 
##  Data Driven Smooth Test for Expotentiality
## 
## data:  z, base: ddst.base.legendre, c: 100, Dmax: 5
## W*T* = 81.353, T* = 5, p-value < 2.2e-16
    # when H0 is true
z <- rexp(80, 4)
ddst.exp.test(z, compute.p = TRUE)
    ## 
##  Data Driven Smooth Test for Expotentiality
## 
## data:  z, base: ddst.base.legendre, c: 100, Dmax: 5
## W*T* = 0.50177, T* = 1, p-value = 0.503
    # when H0 is false
z <- rchisq(80, 4)
ddst.exp.test(z, compute.p = TRUE)
    ## 
##  Data Driven Smooth Test for Expotentiality
## 
## data:  z, base: ddst.base.legendre, c: 100, Dmax: 5
## W*T* = 25.55, T* = 2, p-value < 2.2e-16

    3. Data Driven Smooth Tests for Normality

    3.1. The case of bounded basis functions

    # for given vector of 19 numbers
z <- c(13.41, 6.04, 1.26, 3.67, -4.54, 2.92, 0.44, 12.93, 6.77, 10.09,
      4.10, 4.04, -1.97, 2.17, -5.38, -7.30, 4.75, 5.63, 8.84)
ddst.normbounded.test(z, compute.p = TRUE)
    ## 
##  Data Driven Smooth Test for Normality - Bounded Basis Functions
## 
## data:  z, base: ddst.base.legendre, c: 100, Dmax: 10
## W*T* = 0.13095, T* = 1, p-value = 0.7201
    # when H0 is true
z <- rnorm(80)
ddst.normbounded.test(z, compute.p = TRUE)
    ## 
##  Data Driven Smooth Test for Normality - Bounded Basis Functions
## 
## data:  z, base: ddst.base.legendre, c: 100, Dmax: 10
## W*T* = 0.93125, T* = 1, p-value = 0.3536
    # when H0 is false
z = rexp(80, 4)
ddst.normbounded.test(z, B = 5000, compute.p = TRUE)
    ## 
##  Data Driven Smooth Test for Normality - Bounded Basis Functions
## 
## data:  z, base: ddst.base.legendre, c: 100, Dmax: 10
## W*T* = 36.574, T* = 1, p-value = 0.0001344

    3.2. The case of unbounded basis functions

    4. Data Driven Smooth Test for Extreme Value Distribution

    # for given vector of 19 numbers
z <- c(13.41, 6.04, 1.26, 3.67, -4.54, 2.92, 0.44, 12.93, 6.77, 10.09,
      4.10, 4.04, -1.97, 2.17, -5.38, -7.30, 4.75, 5.63, 8.84)
ddst.extr.test(z, compute.p = TRUE)
    ## 
##  Data Driven Smooth Test for Extreme Values
## 
## data:  z, base: ddst.base.legendre, c: 100, Dmax: 5
## W*T* = 1.9073, T* = 1, p-value = 0.607
    library(evd)
z <- -qgumbel(runif(100), -1, 1)
ddst.extr.test(z, compute.p = TRUE)
    ## 
##  Data Driven Smooth Test for Extreme Values
## 
## data:  z, base: ddst.base.legendre, c: 100, Dmax: 5
## W*T* = 0.98006, T* = 1, p-value = 0.993
    # when H0 is false
z <- rexp(80, 4)
ddst.extr.test(z, compute.p = TRUE)
    ## 
##  Data Driven Smooth Test for Extreme Values
## 
## data:  z, base: ddst.base.legendre, c: 100, Dmax: 5
## W*T* = 159692, T* = 5, p-value < 2.2e-16

    III. Nonparametric Data Driven Smooth Tests for Comparing Distributions

    5. Data Driven Smooth Test for k-Sample Problem

    # H0 is true
x = runif(80)
y = runif(80)
z = runif(80)
t <- ddst.ksample.test(x, y, z)
t
    ## 
##  Data Driven k-Sample Test
## 
## data:  x, Dmax: 12
## WT = 2.7821, T = (1, 1, 1)
    plot(t)

    # known fixed alternative
x = runif(80)
y = rbeta(80,4,2)
w = rnorm(30)
z = rexp(10, 1)
t <- ddst.ksample.test(x, y, w, z)
t
    ## 
##  Data Driven k-Sample Test
## 
## data:  x, Dmax: 12
## WT = 193.11, T = (5, 3, 9, 12)
    plot(t)

    6. Data Driven Smooth Test for Stochastic Dominance in Two Samples

    set.seed(13)
library("rmutil", warn.conflicts = FALSE)
# 1. Pareto(1)/Pareto(1.5)
x <- rpareto(50, 2, 2)
y <- rpareto(50, 1.5, 1.5)
t <- ddst.forstochdom.test(x, y)
t
    ## 
##  Data Driven Stochastic Ordering Test
## 
## data:  x, t: 2.2, Dmax: 4
## QT = 130.93, = 5
    plot(t)

    # 2. Laplace(0,1)/Laplace(1,25)
x <- rlaplace(50, 0, 1)
y <- rlaplace(50, 1, 25)
t <- ddst.forstochdom.test(x, y)
t
    ## 
##  Data Driven Stochastic Ordering Test
## 
## data:  x, t: 2.2, Dmax: 4
## QT = 111.11, = 5
    plot(t)

    # 3. LN(0.85,0.6)/LN(1.2,0.2)
x <- rlnorm(50, 0.85, 0.6)
y <- rlnorm(50, 1.2, 0.2)
t <- ddst.forstochdom.test(x, y)
t
    ## 
##  Data Driven Stochastic Ordering Test
## 
## data:  x, t: 2.2, Dmax: 4
## QT = 0, = 1
    plot(t)

    7. Two-Sample Test Against Stochastic Dominance

    # H0 is true
x <- runif(80)
y <- runif(80)
t <- ddst.againststochdom.test(x, y)
t
    ## 
##  Data Driven Test Against Stochastic Dominance
## 
## data:  x, alpha: 0.05, t: 2.2, Dmax: 4
## VT = 0.4, T = 1
    plot(t)

    # known fixed alternative
x <- runif(80)
y <- rbeta(80,4,2)
t <- ddst.againststochdom.test(x, y)
t
    ## 
##  Data Driven Test Against Stochastic Dominance
## 
## data:  x, alpha: 0.05, t: 2.2, Dmax: 4
## VT = -60.8, T = 5
    plot(t)

    8. Data Driven Smooth Test for Upward Trend Alternative in k samples

    # H0 is true
x = runif(80)
y = runif(80) + 0.2
z = runif(80) + 0.4
t <- ddst.upwardtrend.test(list(x, y, z))
t
    ## 
##  Data Driven k-Sample Upward Trend Test
## 
## data:  
## U.T = 830.58, p = 3
    plot(t)

    # known fixed alternative
x1 = rnorm(80)
x2 = rnorm(80) + 2
x3 = rnorm(80) + 4
x4 = rnorm(80) + 3
t <- ddst.upwardtrend.test(list(x1, x2, x3, x4))
t
    ## 
##  Data Driven k-Sample Upward Trend Test
## 
## data:  
## U.T = -3665.2, p = 4
    plot(t)

    9. Data Driven Smooth Test for Umbrella Alternatives in k samples

    # H0 is true
x = runif(80)
y = runif(80)
z = runif(80)
t <- ddst.umbrella.test(x, y, z)
t
    ## 
##  Data Driven k-Sample Umbrella Test
## 
## data:  
## U.T = 0.066667, p = 3
    plot(t)

    # known fixed alternative
x = runif(80)
y = rbeta(80,4,2)
w = rnorm(30)
z = rexp(10, 1)
t <- ddst.umbrella.test(x, y, w, z)
t
    ## 
##  Data Driven k-Sample Umbrella Test
## 
## data:  
## U.T = -326.88, p = 3
    plot(t)

    10. Data Driven Smooth Test for Change-Point Problem
